Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Hydroxyl-riched, ordered mesoporous framework with spherical particles forming a stacked coating

Other Information.Additional Info: High exclusion efficiencies (>93%) for seven selected proteins.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-selected adsorption and specific functional group interaction

Other Information.Additional Info: Maximum adsorption capacity of 145.31 µg (72.66 mg/g). Successfully extracted from mice's plasma.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-selected adsorption and specific functional group interaction

Other Information.Additional Info: Maximum adsorption capacity of 84.75 µg (42.38 mg/g). Successfully extracted from mice's plasma.
Adsorption effect was much worse due to larger molecular size compared to luteolin and quercetagetin.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Passes too readily through pores, insufficient interaction due to small size

Other Information.Additional Info: Molecular size was much smaller than the pore size of COF-DES-1, leading to difficulty in interaction and retention.

Guest Molecules.Molecule Name: Luteolin metabolites (e.g., chrysoeriol, diosmetin, luteolin sulfate salt, luteolin glucuronides)
Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-selected adsorption due to structural similarity to parent compound

Other Information.Additional Info: Successfully detected in mice's plasma; Parent nuclear structure and most functional groups consistent with luteolin.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving and size exclusion based on pore aperture, complemented by specific functional group interactions for selective adsorption.

Experimental Validation.Method: Protein exclusion experiments, Static adsorption isotherm, Adsorption kinetic, Selectivity experiments, HPLC-MS/MS analysis for biological samples.
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: High protein exclusion efficiencies (>93%); Max adsorption capacities for luteolin (145.31 µg or 72.66 mg/g) and quercetagetin (84.75 µg or 42.38 mg/g); Good selectivity for luteolin and quercetagetin over larger molecules (rutin) or those with different functional groups (emodin, berberine); Superior extraction efficiency for luteolin and quercetagetin/metabolites from mice's plasma compared to traditional protein precipitation.

Other Information.Additional Info: Hydroxyl-riched COF; Employed as a coating for solid-phase microextraction (SPME) fiber; Good thermal stability up to 320 °C; Hydrophilic property (water contact angle 89.38°); Reusable for 5 adsorption-desorption cycles.
